isis.stitle: GAUGES AND WARNING LIGHTS - DIAGNOSTICS - SUSPECT DATA LINK CIRCUITS

svcproc.title: SUSPECT DATA LINK CIRCUITS
svcproc.para: If the power up test by the Speedo/Tach module causes the speedometer and tachometer pointers to sweep in unison, and the tachometer sweeps three times between 0 and 1500 rpm while the speedo sweeps between 0 and 38 mph:

step1.para: Use a Pro-Link 9000 or EZ-Tech EST to attempt to read engine rpm, oil pressure and water temperature at data link connector (137).

step2.para: If the EST reads information from the ECM, troubleshoot speedometer circuits between data link connectors (514) and (515) and Speedo/Tach module connector (421). If those circuits check good, replace the Speedo/Tach module.
If the EST cannot communicate with the ECM, refer to 08, Electronic Engine Controls, in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual, and troubleshoot the data link circuits.

Insure that the vehicle Data Link is not shorted or wired incorrectly. With the ignition on, voltage from Positive data link circuit to ground should be approximately 4 volts. Voltage from Negative data link circuit to ground should be approximately 1 volt.
